He himself admitted that they were meeting less as time went on.
Hence he should not hold a grudge and move on.

Also the way they broke up, didn't give closure to any of them. They had sex argued and just broke up.
Him sayin he was sorry didn't mean that he will get back together with her.
It just means that he forgave her.

My guy isn't even being a cuck. Sure, his girl cheated multiple times(implied), and that's grounds for a break up. But, the woman's words got him thinking. Relationships won't last long without effort put in, especially long distance. I'm not sure what the outcome of his love story will be, but considering that he arrived to Tokyo, where his girl is, they definitely had a talk. Also, the woman talked about how it doesn't mean she should be forgiven, and that it feels better with someone you like, so this could insinuate that his girl didn't feel good not just because he was an amateur, but because she didn't like him anymore. This could lead into a break up anyway, but the point was that it got him thinking about his own faults. That he should better himself, not that he should forgive his girl. Regardless, this ends with a confrontation, not even considering whether the woman or his girl will be in his future or not.

Overall I think he learned a valuable lesson about relationships overall. But I don’t think he should get back together with his girlfriend. She has already cheated on him and they would still be long distance even if they got back together. There’s no real future for them. I think they should apologize to each other and move on, but if he tries to continue the relationship, especially when she has a new boyfriend, I don’t think he really learned much at all. 
It would be best for him to apply everything he knows to a more feasible relationship for himself. Recovering from cheating isn’t as easy as it sounds and realistically when he goes back home he would feel insecure and suspect she’s found another boyfriend again. All around toxic relationship. He should meet up with her, maturely end things and let it go.

I actually rewatch it a few times, I still do not think this is meant to be wholesome, the girl thanks him with the sweetest smile at the end because this is her first time making love, she gets fucked a lot before and she finally finds someone she genuinely likes, so she teaches him how to make a woman feel good in round 2, it feels better for both of them when he is going gentle, both of them are enjoying it, they kiss and hug in round 2 instead of just fucking like round 1. “They make love like lovers”. The difference between round 1 and round 2 is the highlight here. This is why she shows confident, calm and matured faces at the beginning and in round 1 but her faces in round 2 are so loving, affectionate and passionate, because she this is the first time she can enjoy sex, this is the first time she make love. That is why she tells him people’s hearts are weak because she knows exactly why she did it with those terrible men before.

(Part 2) So it is up to the guy to decide if he wants to continue the relationship with his GF or not. She does not like what she did, but she understands how lonely feels because she was there. That’s the difference. She also reminds him doing it with someone you like is going to feel better because this is what she learns from this, she can move forward and hopefully find a guy that actually cherishes her. Now with the guy, he is still young and naive, so he still needs to stumble along his path before he can “become a man”. 
So in her perspective this is wholesome because she is now a new person, she is saved by the guy. If you honestly think “good art, trash story” you should really pay more attention to the art this artist is presenting, the difference of expressions is telling a lot of story here.

Love the artwork and story. Their encounter feels like seeing two sides of a coin: one moving forward in life, the other backward. 

The lady had some rough phases in her life and still came out of it as a warm-hearted person. Her encounter with the boy came across is as if she can close this chapter of her life and start anew. She finally experienced the difference when you are with someone you really like. She even thanked him for helping her to realise this. I'm rooting for her that she finds a loving relationship for herself.

The boy on the other hand is in a different phase in his life and also still has to learn what it means to be in a loving relationship. He is still thinking in a tit for tat way. So this encounter did not have the same life-changing weight for the boy as for the lady. I think he would also have crawled back without meeting this lady. To me, this was a chance to see it differently, since he also was reflecting in lines of "it feels as if we are lovers".
This is why Japan's population is declining, because they keep allowing cuck shit like this to be acceptable. The ex girlfriend is a whore. Delete her number and move on.

By the way, it's really fucking retarded how the author tries to be all deep about the fact that MC also had sex with the blonde girl. MC wasn't cheating on anyone. He didn't fuck the blonde girl out of loneliness, and he didn't choose momentary pleasure over his love for someone else. No surprise here, though. A Japanese author being a simp, wow. I don't know where did people see her justifying girlfriend's behavior. She literary says that it probably can't be forgiven. There is a difference between understanding why someone did something, and condoning such behavior. She tells the guy that it's on him to decide how he wants to go about it. Him apologizing to her first is a bit of a joke though.

Funny that I was recently reminded of an article about cheating in Japan. Can't see your boyfriend as often as you want? Get a second boyfriend. Which is what the MC's girlfriend did. In a country where a quarter of female survey respondants said that even fucking someone else might not be considered cheating? What the girlfriend did here could be considered acceptable too some. Especially to one broken inside lady who has never had a healthy relationship in her life and who just happened to be on the same bus.

Not sure how I feel about this. One hand the woman is hot. The other hand the MC is an idiot for letting her make him think your girlfriend cheating on you is OK and that he should let let the pain and hate go and reconcile with her. Delete her number and move on. Also, I'm entirely sure he used the rubber or not but, if he went raw on a woman who was passed around more time than a baseball at a Baseball championship game then he definitely needs to get tested.

Explayning: The guy and the girl were dating, they didn't have sex. The guy went to study in Tokyo and after a while came home. Met with a girlfriend, they had sex, where he lost his virginity. She told him that he was bad (which is not surprising if this is the guy's first time). The guy realized that she had an experience with someone else. She began to justify that the guy was far away, and she was lonely... So she admitted that she cheated on him.  This can be seen on the very first frame. So they broke up. Then guy has sex with this blonde in the bus. In the end blonde say him some shit about peoples weak hearts and about someone choose  person who nearby instead his boyfriend/girlfriend. Guy released he had sex with blonde. The guy thought about it and decided to apologize to his girlfriend. 
The moral of the story that the author brings - if you are lonely, you can fuck with anyone who is nearby. Everything is fine because this not love. PS Seems, the blonde also came to her BF.

Geology (from the Ancient Greek γῆ, gē ("earth") and -λoγία, -logia, ("study of", "discourse"))[1][2] is an Earth science concerned with the solid Earth, the rocks of which it is composed, and the processes by which they change over time. Geology can also include the study of the solid features of any terrestrial planet or natural satellite such as Mars or the Moon. Modern geology significantly overlaps all other Earth sciences, including hydrology and the atmospheric sciences, and so is treated as one major aspect of integrated Earth system science and planetary science.

Geology describes the structure of the Earth on and beneath its surface, and the processes that have shaped that structure. It also provides tools to determine the relative and absolute ages of rocks found in a given location, and also to describe the histories of those rocks.[3] By combining these tools, geologists are able to chronicle the geological history of the Earth as a whole, and also to demonstrate the age.
